overview_of_class: Course describes the neuroaudiological and neuropsychological bases of, assessment of, and intervention for central auditory processing disorders (CAPDs) among children and adults. Topics include overview of peripheral and central auditory nervous system neuroanatomy and physiology, auditory neurodevelopment, formal and informal assessment tools, special considerations for testing, diagnostic test scoring and interpretation, screening, management strategies, remediation programs and techniques, service delivery options, and conveying diagnostic/intervention information to clients, families and caregivers.
name: Evaluation and Treatment of Central Auditory Processing Disorders

descriptions.name: Overview of class
descriptions.value: Course describes the neuroaudiological and neuropsychological bases of, assessment of, and intervention for central auditory processing disorders (CAPDs) among children and adults. Topics include overview of peripheral and central auditory nervous system neuroanatomy and physiology, auditory neurodevelopment, formal and informal assessment tools, special considerations for testing, diagnostic test scoring and interpretation, screening, management strategies, remediation programs and techniques, service delivery options, and conveying diagnostic/intervention information to clients, families and caregivers.

descriptions.name: Learning Objectives
descriptions.value:
At the end of this course, students will be able to:
1) identify neuroanatomical landmarks of the central auditory nervous system IV B-4)
2) describe key neurophysiological bases of central auditory processing (IV B-8)
3) list and define known central auditory processes (IV B-8)
4) describe components of typical behavioral diagnostic central auditory evaluation (IV D-6, D-7)
5) implement a screening program for central auditory dysfunction (IV C-3, C-4)
6) administer and score typical central auditory function tests (IV D-6, D-7)
7) interpret test results using a deficit-specific model (IV D-12)
8) describe general principles of intervention of central auditory disorders (IV B-2, B-3,E-2, E-5)
9) make recommendations for effective deficit-specific CAPD management and treatment (IV B-2, D-16)
10) report evaluation findings and recommendations to parents and other professionals (IV C-1, D-1, D-13, D-16, E-1, E-3, E-6)

descriptions.value:

Failure to maintain academic integrity on an assignment will result in a loss of credit for that assignment, at a minimum.

In compliance with equal access laws, the instructor is available to discuss appropriate academic accommodations that may be required by students with disabilities. Please make these requests during the first week of the quarter, except in unusual circumstances, so that arrangements can be made.
